It was devastating to watch the news of multiple fires around our state last evening and into this morning. We are monitoring this situation very closely and it‚Äôs likely there are NCSD families and staff who had to evacuate their homes last evening due to the fires. We are deeply saddened by this news and grateful to hear from Clackamas County emergency response that they were able to evacuate everyone safely. If your family has been impacted by the fires, please let your school know so they can assist you.

At this time, our staff is prepared to operate as close to scheduled as possible. We know that being able to make connections with peers and staff is sometimes the best support that our students need. NCSD is in contact with local emergency responders, and will continue monitoring the situation.

Please stay safe and reach out if you or someone you know needs assistance.

The US Constitution calls for a complete census of the United States and US Territories every ten years. 2020 is a census year and the data gathered is used to reallocate Federal tax funds to States, Counties and Municipalities. Census data is used to apportion congressional seats, determine public infrastructure and other critical services. Census data also impacts public education.

There is currently a recruitment drive to hire over 2,000 people to work as Census Enumerators and Census Field Supervisors in Clackamas and Multnomah Counties. The positions are temporary and pay $18-$20/hr.

More info and application here: 2020census.gov/jobs
